## Lab 8

Load Packages

``` r
library(tidyverse)
```

**Exersize 1: For loops**

Approach 1: Null output

``` r
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- NULL
for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z <- c(z, x[i] + y[i])
}
z
```

Approach 2: defined output

``` r
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- vector(mode = "double", length=10)
for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z[i] <- x[i] + y[i]
}
z
```

compare the two approaches

``` r

x <- 1:100000
y <- 100001:200000
z <- NULL
time_null <- system.time(
for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z <- c(z, x[i] + y[i])
})
z
time_null

x <- 1:100000
y <- 100001:200000
z <- vector(mode = "double", length=10)
time_defined <- system.time(
for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z[i] <- x[i] + y[i]
})
z
time_defined
```

[**For 100,000 iterations:**]{.underline}

Null approach system time = .34

Null approach user time = 11.91

Defined approach System time = 0.0

Defined approach user time = 0.05

**The system time and user time of the null approach was larger, meaning it was slower and therefore less efficient!**

**Exersise 2: Infinite Monkeys**

```r

characters <- c(letters, " ", ",", "!")

string <- paste(sample(characters, 1000, replace = TRUE))

string[1] <- sample(LETTERS, 1)

string2 <- vector(mode = "character", length=length(string))

for (i in length(string)) { 
x <- ifelse(string[i] == "o","q", string[i])
string2[i] <- x
}

string2


```
